Package logic.gameObjects

Class Placeable

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.gameObjects.Placeable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Goose, Hero, InfinityStone, Rock, StanLee, Thanos
    public abstract class Placeable
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface for all objects that can be placed on a field.
    Author:
    Luka Stoehr

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean compareIDs​(IDs entityIDs)
      Checks if this Placeable matches to the given IDs object used to identify entities during the Ingame Phase.
      IDs getIDs()
      Returns the IDs object of this Placeable as specified in the network standard document.
      int[] getPosAsArray()
      Getter for the position of this Placeable, but returns the Position as int[] array, as needed in the Ingame Messages.

      Getter for the position of this Placeable

      Entities toEntity()

    • Field Detail

      • model

        public Model model
        Model of this match.

      • entityID

        public EntityID entityID
        EntityID of this Placeable. Placeables are Entities in the Network Standard document.

      • ID

        public int ID
        ID of this Placeable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Placeable

        public Placeable​(EntityID entityID,
                 int ID)
        Constructor for Placeable
        Parameters:
        entityID - EntityID as specified in Network Standard
        ID - ID as specified in Network Standard

    • Method Detail

      • place

        public boolean place​(Position position)
        Called when an object is to be placed on the field. Placeable can only be placed on empty field.
        Parameters:
        position - where object should be placed
        Returns:
        Whether placing was successful

      • move

        public abstract boolean move​(Position newPosition)
        Called when an object should be moved on the field. As Stones and characters behave differently, this is abstract. Currently a placeable can only be moved to a neighbouring field with this method. For several steps, this method needs to be called several times.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - where the object is moved to, must be a neighbouring field
        Returns:
        Whether moving the object was successful

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Getter for the position of this Placeable
        Returns:
        current Position of this object or null if not found

      • getPosAsArray

        public int[] getPosAsArray()
        Getter for the position of this Placeable, but returns the Position as int[] array, as needed in the Ingame Messages.
        Returns:
        current Position of this object or empty array (new int[0]) if Placeable is currently not on map

      • isNeighbour

        public boolean isNeighbour​(Position otherPos)
        Checks if a Position is on a neighbouring field of this Placeable.
        Parameters:
        otherPos - The other field, to which the position is compared.
        Returns:
        true if position is a neighbour of this placeable

      • compareIDs

        public boolean compareIDs​(IDs entityIDs)
        Checks if this Placeable matches to the given IDs object used to identify entities during the Ingame Phase. The IDs object consists of a entityID and an ID.
        Parameters:
        entityIDs - IDs object to compare
        Returns:
        True, if same entity

      • getIDs

        public IDs getIDs()
        Returns the IDs object of this Placeable as specified in the network standard document.
        Returns:
        IDs

      • toEntity

        public Entities toEntity()
        Translates this Placeable object to an Entities object that is needed for some network messages.
        Returns:
        Entity, or null in case of error
